title: >>> SECOND is the BEST
body_text:
An intense renegade, willing to fight to the death.
A "scummy", blocking extraordinaire.
Ten events later, they meet again.
And it's all Lenny's fault!
basista, marzarella ... round 2
Is second really the best? If you're referring to the
DODGEBALL 84
rematch, that answer is real clear.
The legends came to play - Justin Pierce, Kevin Megill, Alison Bertsch, Melissa Kerr, Mike Butler, just to name a few. Pair them with sensational newbies Jeff Hill, the Phillips Brothers, Ricky Fortunato, among others, and again another refreshingly unique clash of styles and strategies to an already explosive atmosphere. Throw in the unforgiving bulletballs, the life-saving
Letsche
targets, some "B" freakin' "12", and this is the outcome ...
The reckless showman Basista pulled out all the stops, bulldozing through four games unrelentingly. Had it not been for Kevin Adams's five-star performance to close Game 5, Team RAY would have gone winless at NINETY 4.
Sascha Basista defeated Ray Marzarella, 4 to 1, in one unforgettable, record-setting events of the year.
Moments & Stars
: The extraordinary night of one Kevin Adams; the game-saving rimshot by Sascha Basista in Game 3; the brave return of legend Mike "Sputz" Krott; John Tronolone's fumble catch; Tom Adams's vicious foot shots on Alison Bertsch
"The large influx of new people and some very surprising returns proves that there is always something fresh going on. You never want to miss."
- ALISON BERTSCH
Big Time RECORDS
> Attendance: 39
> Notable Returns: Zach Katz (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 72)
> New Players: (11) Nate Miernik, Alim Aqqabil, Jared Phillips, Jason Phillips, Josh Phillips, Dave Delpizzo, Mike Mcgee, Ricky Fortunato, Jeff Hill, Louie Kossmann, Ron Hendrick.
- The attendance of 39 is the 4th highest of all-time.
- DODGEBALL NINETY 4 featured an astounding 33 male participants, the most since DODGEBALL 50. This is only the fourth event with 30 or more male players.
- The
Letsche Rims
served as team regenerators for the fifth straight event.
- In the DODGEBALL 84 rematch, Sascha Basista defeated Ray Marzarella by a score of 4 to 1. This was the third consecutive "four"-event Sascha was a team captain. Sascha's record is 2-1-1 while Ray stands at 1-2-2.
- DODGEBALL NINETY 4 fell on the one year anniversary of DODGEBALL 46.
________________________________________
________
DODGEBALL 95
MEGILL v. EDWARDS 2
The mid-season main event! DODGEBALL 80 opponents collide once again! Check back during the week for the official preview!
________________________________________
________
coming 8.18.07

An intense renegade, willing to fight to the death.
A "scummy", blocking extraordinaire.
Ten events later, they meet again.
And it's all Lenny's fault!

basista, marzarella ... round 2
Is second really the best? If you're referring to the DODGEBALL 84 rematch, that answer is real clear.

The legends came to play - Justin Pierce, Kevin Megill, Alison Bertsch, Melissa Kerr, Mike Butler, just to name a few. Pair them with sensational newbies Jeff Hill, the Phillips Brothers, Ricky Fortunato, among others, and again another refreshingly unique clash of styles and strategies to an already explosive atmosphere. Throw in the unforgiving bulletballs, the life-saving Letsche targets, some "B" freakin' "12", and this is the outcome ...

The reckless showman Basista pulled out all the stops, bulldozing through four games unrelentingly. Had it not been for Kevin Adams's five-star performance to close Game 5, Team RAY would have gone winless at NINETY 4.

Sascha Basista defeated Ray Marzarella, 4 to 1, in one unforgettable, record-setting events of the year.

Moments & Stars: The extraordinary night of one Kevin Adams; the game-saving rimshot by Sascha Basista in Game 3; the brave return of legend Mike "Sputz" Krott; John Tronolone's fumble catch; Tom Adams's vicious foot shots on Alison Bertsch

"The large influx of new people and some very surprising returns proves that there is always something fresh going on. You never want to miss."
- ALISON BERTSCH

Big Time RECORDS
> Attendance: 39
> Notable Returns: Zach Katz (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 72)
> New Players: (11) Nate Miernik, Alim Aqqabil, Jared Phillips, Jason Phillips, Josh Phillips, Dave Delpizzo, Mike Mcgee, Ricky Fortunato, Jeff Hill, Louie Kossmann, Ron Hendrick.

- The attendance of 39 is the 4th highest of all-time.
- DODGEBALL NINETY 4 featured an astounding 33 male participants, the most since DODGEBALL 50. This is only the fourth event with 30 or more male players.
- The Letsche Rims served as team regenerators for the fifth straight event.
- In the DODGEBALL 84 rematch, Sascha Basista defeated Ray Marzarella by a score of 4 to 1. This was the third consecutive "four"-event Sascha was a team captain. Sascha's record is 2-1-1 while Ray stands at 1-2-2.
- DODGEBALL NINETY 4 fell on the one year anniversary of DODGEBALL 46.
